channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Defense Department reaches plea agreement with 3 of the men charged in 9/11 attacks
item.description: The U.S. Defense Department has reached a plea agreement with three of the five men charged in the Sept. 11, 2001, terror attacks, including alleged 9/11 mastermind Khalid Shaikh Mohammad.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Defense Department has reached a plea agreement with three of the five men charged in the Sept. 11, 2001, terror attacks, including alleged 9/11 mastermind Khalid Shaikh Mohammad.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Boar's Head has recalled 7 million pounds of deli meat over listeria risk
item.description: Seven million pounds of deli meat has been recalled by Boar's Head because of listeria risk. The meat was sold all over the country.
item.content:encoded: Seven million pounds of deli meat has been recalled by Boar's Head because of listeria risk. The meat was sold all over the country.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Self-managed abortion with mifepristone doubled after 'Roe' fell, study shows
item.description: A study looks at the rate of self-managed abortion since Roe v. Wade fell. The study found that the use of mifepristone to self-manage abortion has nearly doubled from 6.6% in 2021 to 11.0% in 2023.
item.content:encoded: A study looks at the rate of self-managed abortion since Roe v. Wade fell. The study found that the use of mifepristone to self-manage abortion has nearly doubled from 6.6% in 2021 to 11.0% in 2023.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Varney

item.title: Sicily's farmers struggle through worst drought in history
item.description: The Mediterranean island of Sicily has experienced its worst drought in recent history. The effects on farmers in particular are already proving very damaging.
item.content:encoded: The Mediterranean island of Sicily has experienced its worst drought in recent history. The effects on farmers in particular are already proving very damaging.
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Trump says he 'didn't know' Harris was Black at NABJ convention
item.description: Former President Donald J. Trump did a question and answer session at the 2024 National Association of Black Journalists conference this week.
item.content:encoded: Former President Donald J. Trump did a question and answer session at the 2024 National Association of Black Journalists conference this week.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: One man has been working for a decade to clean up ocean oil leaks from WWII warships
item.description: There are more than an estimated 3000 World War II shipwrecks across the Pacific Ocean. After years of decay, some of the wrecks are spilling thousands of tons of oil and fuel into the sea.
item.content:encoded: There are more than an estimated 3000 World War II shipwrecks across the Pacific Ocean. After years of decay, some of the wrecks are spilling thousands of tons of oil and fuel into the sea.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: How much gold is in an Olympic gold medal? Not as much as you might think
item.description: What are Olympic medals made of? According to International Olympic Committee regulations, the Olympic gold medals must be made out of at least 92.5% silver. But then are plated with gold.
item.content:encoded: What are Olympic medals made of? According to International Olympic Committee regulations, the Olympic gold medals must be made out of at least 92.5% silver. But then are plated with gold.
item.dc:creator: Jonas Adams

item.title: Assassination of Hamas leader inflames regional tensions
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Khaled Elgindy, senior fellow at the Middle East Institute, about what the future may look like for Hamas after one of its top leader was allegedly assassinated by Israel.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Khaled Elgindy, senior fellow at the Middle East Institute, about what the future may look like for Hamas after one of its top leader was allegedly assassinated by Israel.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: BMX racer overcame personal and professional loss to end up on Paris' starting hill
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks to Team USA BMX racer Alise Willoughby about her expectations for Paris and her training partnership with her husband, the former BMX racer Sam Willoughby.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks to Team USA BMX racer Alise Willoughby about her expectations for Paris and her training partnership with her husband, the former BMX racer Sam Willoughby.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: Wildfire smoke has been settling in the American West
item.description: After two easy-breathing summers, dreaded wildfire smoke is settling in across California and the West. Public health officials warn these megafires aren't just emitting smoke from burning forests.
item.content:encoded: After two easy-breathing summers, dreaded wildfire smoke is settling in across California and the West. Public health officials warn these megafires aren't just emitting smoke from burning forests.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler
